alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 2:24AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Bracken and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 224 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Olivet, Sardis, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Hittville, US Route 62 at State Route 616, Kentontown, Santa Fe, Piqua, Mitchells Mill, Milford, Burika, US Route 62 at State Route 19, Blue Licks Battlefield and Alhambra.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
